title: Efficient Revenue Mobilization
description: In 2023, Samoa achieved a CPIA efficiency of revenue mobilization rating of 4.5, indicating a strong capacity to collect revenues effectively.

title: Strong Fiscal Policy
description: Samoa's CPIA fiscal policy rating reached 4.5 in 2023, reflecting a robust fiscal framework and prudent economic management.

title: Quality Public Administration
description: With a CPIA quality of public administration rating of 4 in 2023, Samoa demonstrates a competent and effective public sector.

title: High Unmet Need for Contraception
description: In 2020, 38.9% of married women aged 15-49 in Samoa had an unmet need for contraception, highlighting significant gaps in reproductive health services.

title: Minimal Merchandise Imports from Outside Region
description: In 2023, only 0.16% of Samoa's total merchandise imports came from low- and middle-income economies outside the region, indicating limited trade diversification.

title: Limited International Tourism Expenditures
description: Samoa's international tourism expenditures were valued at approximately $1.8 million in 2020, suggesting a modest tourism sector.

title: Moderate Public Sector Management
description: In 2023, Samoa's CPIA public sector management and institutions cluster average was 4.1, indicating a moderate level of effectiveness in public sector governance.

title: Low Subsidies and Transfers
description: In 2021, subsidies and other transfers accounted for only 6.13% of Samoa's expenses, reflecting limited government support programs.
